resources.string: A modern programming language used for web development.
Modern, concise, safe, expressive, interoperable and multiplatform.
You can code anywhere. Most popular code editor is VSCode
Get familiar with the main function and run the most basic JavaScript program.
Get to know prompt and console.log functions.
Learn about comments, naming variables and some coding style conventions.
Variables in JavaScript can be immutable (const) and mutable (let)
number, string, boolean, null, undefined and so on
In JavaScript we can work with nullable types and non-nullable types for null safety.
JavaScript allows us to cast almost all types with a few exceptions.
JavaScript allows to work with async code
In JavaScript you may concatenate two strings by having the variable value inside the quotes: `${first} ${second}`
You should learn all mathematical and boolean operators.
This data structure is fundamental. It allows you to collect items of the same type, allowing duplicates and having a unique position.
JavaScript also provides the set, the map, and the array data structure.
Learn how to declare and invoke functions. Also learn about default and named arguments.
JavaScript provides the if/when expressions and the for/while loops.
Exceptions are run time errors that crashes the program execution if not properly handled.
JavaScript provides a way to work with functions as if they were objects.
Learn about classes, member functions and constructors.
Explore the power of inheritance, encapsulation, polymorphism, and data abstraction.
Make your JavaScript more powerful and typesafe.
For classes that hold only data, for constants and for complex objects.
JavaScript provides easy access to singletons trough objects and companion objects.
These cannot be instantiated bur rather define the rules for future implementation.
JavaScript with help of TypeScript supports generic programming.
The Random and the Math libraries are essential.
Learn about file hierarchies, reading from a file and writing to a file.
Make your own project using new knowledge
See more or less information about a tip.
